inn1.comm: shapes in right away into the right hander from a good length, defended down the track
starts a touch wider from the batsman, who gets across, allows it to swing in, and blocks
this one slants across him now, on a good length, and he shoulders arms
width from back of a length, it bounces but slowly, and is cut down to third man
straightens after starting across the right hander, defended tightly onto the off side
much fuller, and moving in a foot outside off stump, he allows it go past
starts straight and far outside off stump from short of a length, close to being a wide
slightly fuller, and moving away late but still too far outside off to be fiddled with
gets the line right now, ending around off from short of a length, he drops it towards backward point who is quick to get to the ball to cut off the single
more bounce for Morne, at 141 kph, bangs it in, and gets it to move away as well, Nicol gets on his toes and has a waft at it, beaten
still quicker, and moving in this time, shapes down the leg side from outside off stump, given a wide, unjust world if you are a bowler
left alone outside off
this time he is able to get on top of the bounce off this widish delivery and cut it down to third man
that has almost taken out middle stump, Nicol advances down the track to try and lift the length ball over midwicket, but it shapes in to beat him, and just bounces over the stumps
moving in but down the pads, and rolls away square on the leg side
pushes a length ball in front of mid on and sets off for a very comfortable single
he beats the batsman on the attempted pull with a bouncer, but unfortunately for the bowler, it takes off so much that it even beats the keeper
swinging in sharply from around leg stump and carrying down the leg side
steady length delivery pushed into the leg side
defended down the track
on the front foot, right behind the line of the good length ball angled in, blocks it solidly
ends up on middle and leg with the angle now, turned on to the leg side softly
that's the line, Morne continues to get bounce from just short of a length, the line is close to off stump, and it scoots past the outside edge
still shorter, that's a ripper, Guptill just about manages to bend his knees and get his head out of the way of the bouncer coming in
appeal for leg before now with a fuller delivery now, but it was going way down the leg side
pushes forward, opens the face and gets this length ball down the third man
too full and swinging in down the pads, whipped eagerly down to fine leg
he was moving across to try and counter the inswing, but Tsotsobe dropped it short and the batsman had to weave out of the line as it zipped across him

Nicol is feeling the pressure, he charges out to Tsotsobe for the second time to a length ball angled across him, and has a heave at it, thick edge flies behind point but drops well short of third man
pushed solidly off the front foot to extra cover
testing bowling from South Africa, they have used the short ball well, Tsotsobe goes past the edge with another one
thick outside edge scoots along the ground to point as he looks to drive a pitched up ball
oh boy, what a first ball, good pace, angled in full on off stump and curves away to leave Nicol clueless
pitched up again and swinging away, but slightly wider and allows him to get the front foot and drive with the movement past extra cover, superb stroke when it comes off
shorter this time and he can leave it alone outside off
beaten by the away movement as he stays in the crease and pushes at the good length delivery
shaping away all the time, very full, right on off stump, he adjusts to softly guide it to point

Nicol gets four off the last ball, not entirely in control, but he gave Steyn the charge and went through with the swing, and managed to get the full delivery down the pitch, Steyn gets his hands to it but it bursts through to run into the straight boundary
pushes a pitched up delivery to mid on
shortish ball punched to mid on, who is standing up closer than usual
too short, and wide as well, they have not given much to hit, but this one was waiting to be smashed, Guptill does exactly that, he waits and hammers it past extra cover
and there is the breakthrough, they have bowled too well to not have a wicket early, Tsotsobe pitches it up, and angles it across Guptill, who reaches out to push at it, and feathers it through to AB

that has got to be close, oh dear, Baz has shouldered arms first ball, it has shaped back from a good length and hit him in front, umpire gives him straight away, he has gone for the review, replays show it would have bounced just over the stumps, and McCullum survives
phew, he has absolutely smoked this full delivery, it has gone so hard that it has burst through the man at extra cover, who is down on a knee as he feels the sting of the stroke
defends a straightening fullish one down the track
South Africa continue to bother New Zealand with discipline lines and movement, this one moves away just outside off and just past the edge
and then he hurls it full and way down the pads, and Nicol tickles it fine easily
pushed past cover for a couple

he ducks right into this 143 kph short ball, which does not rise that much, and pings him on the helmet to fly over the keeper, take four leg byes for that, mate, a stare and a few words from Steyn as well
pitched up, swinging away, he does well to get forward and across and run it to point
defends a back of a length ball onto the leg side
widish delivery slanted across the right hander, left alone
pushed to cover
bouncer, but outside off stump, and he lets it go as he gets his head cleanly out of the way
a big stride forward as he pushes the fullish one towards mid off
length ball pushed towards point
pushed back to the bowler
curling away after being angled in fullish outside off stump, he bends forward to softly push towards covers
straightish one some way outside off, draws him towards the line as he runs it towards point
bouncer now, just outside off stump, well avoided, bends the knee, gets down on the ground, and allows it to pass over him

furious stuff from Steyn, 144 kph bouncer taking off for his head just around off stump, he withdraws from the line, very late, de Villiers has a hard time taking it behind the stumps as it leaps at him as well
thick outside edge flies past the lone slip to third man as he punches this shortish one from the crease
good stop from the bowler, Nicol had got across and timed the straight drive well
lets the short ball go across him
left alone outside off
ending around middle and leg from back of a length, he gets around to work it square, big no-ball this one
gets only one off the free-hit, Tsotsobe bowls it near the blockhole around off, forced away to sweeper cover
pushed towards extra cover who gets to his left to cut off the single
pushed softly towards mid off and this time the run is on
drives the flighted ball down to long off
tossed up again, pushed towards cover

another review from McCullum, he does not think he has edged this delivery to the keeper, and he is right, replays do not suggest any edge, neither does HotSpot, good bowling from Peterson though, he drew McCullum forward with flight and got it to spin and bounce away from him, de Villiers frowns
full toss eased down to long off
hit on the pads outside off as he plays for the turn, this one zips straight from a length
shortish and sitting up, he makes some room to crunch the cut, but there is sweeper cover around
pushes the short of a length ball to cover from the crease
keeps him in the crease again with bounce on this one angled in, defended down the pitch
that has been slogged hard, and has disappeared in an instant to the deep midwicket boundary, Nicol charges out, creates a lot of momentum and mows the length delivery
shortish delivery pushed on to the leg side
still shorter, and widish outside off too, he hops and tries to cut it, but mistimes it towards cover
ripper, he tried to ride the bouncer outside off stump, but it left him hopping and fending at it, lucky not to edge it
cut to sweeper cover for one
dips as it is tossed up outside off, pushed to cover for a single, the throw is wayward
reaches out to the flighted ball and squeezes it down to long off
tries to back away and smash it, but mistimes it to short extra cover
turned in front of square leg for one
more flight, very full, smacked in the air to long off
looks to hammer a wide delivery through cover but finds no timing in the stroke, went too hard at it
leaves a good length delivery outside off
this time he gets hold of the widish one and slaps it to Graeme Smith at sweeper cover
runs a back of a length ball coming in, down to third man with almost no room to work with, completely limited-overs, this shot
sliced towards cover-point who cannot stop it cleanly
gets on his toes and on top of the bounce to chop it past a diving point
pushes a tossed up ball to extra cover
arm ball sliding in, he backs away looking for the cut, but it comes in with the angle, and he has  to adjust to keep it out

Peterson strikes, he has been flighting the ball consistently, lures Nicol into a big shot, he only manages a thick edge that looked to be flying past Kallis at slip, but the great man gets to his right to take it as he tumbles to the ground
tossed up delivery pushed to extra cover
stays in the crease to a full delivery and pushes it down the track
straightening on middle and leg, pushed on the leg side
drives an away swinging full delivery hard, it is in the air for a while as it goes to sweeper cover
whoa, that has come in a mile after passing the batsman, who left it alone, superb diving take to his left from AB
back to normal service, draws him forward with the angle into him, and then curls it away to beat the outside edge, what can the batsman do, he can hope, to survive
and again, super, just too good, moving away from a good length, Williamson pushes from the crease as he opens up, beaten again
pitched up full, this time he is able to push it to sweeper cover off the front foot
flicks a full delivery off the pads, it races to fine leg

appeal for leg before as he pushes off the front foot, he was playing for the turn, this one went straight on, this time the umpire is with Baz, this time AB wants the review, will McCullum survive the third time as well? he does, he does, would you believe it, he has got a helpful little inside edge on to pad
nudged square on the leg side
lovely flight, slow through the air, he pushes with the turn to extra cover
good length now, he stays in the crease and punches to cover
tossed up ball defended off the front foot
gives it a big tweak with the fingers, it curves in and straightens, defended solidly off the front foot
tries to get across and swing hard, but mistimes it
off the thigh pad to the keeper, called a wide
bit of width, slapped hard to cover
he moves across again and turns a pacy length delivery to square leg
he is ending up outside off stump as he moves across, leaves the straightish length ball alone, late decision
thickish outside edge as he pushes from the crease, gets back for the second as the throw comes in from third man

he is getting into trouble with that across movement, Steyn hits him on the shoulder with a shortish 146 kph delivery as McCullum ducks right into the line, Steyn turns around and walks away without fuss
well played, he was well on the front foot, but allowed the flighted delivery to pitch and come on outside off, before running it towards third man
he is ready to wait and delay his shot, and that will earn him four, stays back to this length ball and cuts it hard wide of sweeper cover
and again, the cut from the crease will bring him a couple more
goes middle and leg now, and is worked towards midwicket
turning away just outside off stump, he gets across and pushes towards cover
moving around once again, whips it away in front of square leg
nudged behind square leg
low full toss eased back to the bowler who makes a fine stop
slapped away off the back foot to sweeper cover
McCullum prefers to play off the front foot, drops it on the off side
hit wide of long off for a couple
smashed straight to extra cover
flighted delivery turned off middle and leg through midwicket
tossed up ball defended off the front foot
goes back to slap this length ball to cover
flat and short this time, and away to sweeper cover for one
well played, waits for a while before reaching out to ease the full delivery to sweeper cover
short again, he gets across and swivels quickly to pull to deep midwicket
another forcing pull down to deep midwicket
well bowled, flights it across the right hander, pushed in the air down the track
chips with the turn in the air but in the gap between long on and deep midwicket
full delivery driven hard, midwicket saves one with a dive
that's more like the McCullum we know, fullish delivery, in his slot outside off, and he fetches it from there to crash it high over deep midwicket
single to long off to end the over
turned past midwicket for a single
pushed firmly down to long off
they take on point with a quick run and make it safely as he misses the throw at the non-striker's, Mccullum was home by then
lifted in the air over extra cover with the turn, and with lots of assurance
cuts a good length delivery from middle, to sweeper cover
gets across and pushes to cover
forcefully whips a short of a length ball to deep midwicket
beats the outside edge with the angle and some away movement from back of a length
cannot get the single, drops it straight towards cover
too short, too wide, but with sweeper cover in the deep, a violent cut is worth only one
gets hold of the short ball and pulls gracefully to deep midwicket
tries to force a back of a length ball but mishits it to the bowler
punches a short of a length ball straight to cover
angled in towards middle and leg, he pushes it from the crease to long on
they scamper a single between point and extra cover
looks to slice a good length delivery through point but is beaten
punched straight to cover-point
makes a late decision to pull and mistimes the shot to midwicket
angled length delivery scythed down to sweeper cover
fullish ball pushed softly towards long off, so softly that midwicket has the time to come around and field
whoa, McCullum has cracked this pitched up delivery high over deep midwicket, it was headed across him fullish, and he wound up to slam it off the middle of the bat
left alone outside off with the angle
Tsotsobe tries the bouncer, McCullum hooks it along the ground in front of square leg
bouncer climbs way too high over the batsman's head, called a no-ball for being the second one of the over
he sends down another short ball, Williamson gets on top of it and sends it crashing into the deep midwicket boundary with a clean pull
mistimes it back to the bowler as he pushes with an angled bat
he is looking more like McCullum now, this batsman, advances down the track, gets outside leg stump, and slams the length ball wide of sweeper cover
appeal for leg before as he is struck in front after shuffling across, replays have it hitting the top of leg
pushed towards mid on for one
whipped with the angle in front of square leg
opens the face to run it behind point
opens the face to guide this widish delivery to third man
short of a length ball swung off the pads down to fine leg
stays in the crease and steers to third man for one
one-bounce four takes McCullum past 50, again he leaves the crease, ends outside leg and swings at the length delivery, ends up slicing it in the air over covers
swings another shortish ball to fine leg
lets the short ball pass over him as he bends his knees
opens the face to a length ball but finds point
short ball pulled hard to deep square leg
pushed back to the bowler
hit on the pads down the leg side with the length delivery angled in, the ball scoots towards third man
another short ball, another big pull, deep square leg has to scramble to his left to stop the boundary

what an outstanding catch at deep point, McCullum had got hold of this length delivery, and had sliced it hard, Peterson did not have much time, he did very well to run to his left and dived to hold on, no reviews needed for that one, Baz has to walk back this time
mistimes the forcing stroke off this shortish ball to cover
pushed to cover again
flashes at a widish ball and gets it wide of third man
stays in the crease, he does play the ball really late, guides this length ball down to third man
hit in the ribs and he is down on his haunches, he tried to get behind the line of this climbing delivery and missed, took it flush in the ribs
tries the short ball again but sends it way down leg, even as Ryder misses with the pull
pushed away to point
starts with a length ball that spins in towards off, defended down the track
tossed up, and a touch fuller, Williamson comes down the track and punches the ball to long-on
a low full toss is pushed back towards the bowler
pitched up and heading for middle and leg, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on the pads, more defence from Ryder
length and just outside off, Ryder steers the ball towards point
starts the over with a delivery that landed almost outside the pitch, miles outside off
short of length ball is slugged wide of mid-on for full by Williamson, not the best timing or the best-looking of shots, four nonetheless
much more elegant stroke, a controlled drive towards sweeper cover
this is proving to be a very  good over for New Zealand, a length ball is hoicked over midwicket for four, launches it over the fielder in the ring
length ball on middle, Ryder shuffles beyond leg and guides the ball towards backward point
short of length and well outside off, Kallis grunts as he delivers this 135kph ball, dabbed towards backward point for one more

a big wicket for South Africa, Ryder holes out, a short ball just outside off from Kallis, Ryder wants to club that over the leg side, gets a top edge, the ball soars high and towards Graeme Smith at deep square leg, no mistake there, this was shaping up as a good over for New Zealand, but South Africa won't be complaining now
away with a soft push in front of cover
full delivery nudged back down the track
flighted full around off, worked to short fine leg
pushed in the air between the bowler and midwicket, bounces in front of them as they hurry toward the ball
flat delivery slapped away to deep point
tossed up full, eased down to long off for a single
very full delivery wide outside off almost edged on its way to the keeper
length ball off the inner part of the bat to midwicket
charges in and hurls it in fullish with the angle, pushed towards extra cover for a tight single
bowled full on middle and leg, goes straight on and is turned through midwicket
pushes a short of a length ball to extra cover
slaps a short of a length ball towards sweeper cover for an easy single
turned behind square leg for one
nudged towards vacant midwicket for another single
fine run-and-dive from Morne at wide mid off saves the boundary, it was driven neatly off the front foot
he has the ability to quickly go back off the front foot, he does exactly that to cut this length ball to the deep point boundary
driven to sweeper cover
turned to short fine leg off middle
plays very late again, allows this length ball to end around off, and whips it square on the leg side
pitched up on middle stump, pushed down to mid on
short ball pulled away hard to deep midwicket
drops a 144 kph back of a length ball close to the crease on the off side
pushed wide of extra cover where Peterson dives to saves a few runs
worked off the pads behind square leg
moves across, opens up and works this length ball from outside off towards midwicket
slower one from Kallis at 122 kph, Franklin cannot guide it past point
this time he is able to run it wide of third man with an open bat face
comes in from back of a length and hits him on the thigh pad
sliced in the air down to third man
forced from outside off through midwicket
worked through midwicket for one
full delivery squeezed down to third man
wristy work through midwicket brings up an assured half-century from Williamson, rare to see a young old-style patient cricketer like him
pushed towards point for one
misses the pull off this bouncer
short of a length ball worked wide of midwicket
that'll go, too wide and short outside off, Franklin crashes the cut behind point
straightish on middle now, turned towards midwicket
stays in the crease and works forcefully from outside off square on the leg side
middle and leg line, down to deep midwicket for another single
pushed wide of extra cover for one
the width was there, but the cut shot goes straight to point
pushes the pitched up ball in the air but wide of point
goes for the yorker, Franklin gets low to squeeze it back, Tsotsobe has overstepped, the umpire thinks, rough call
scrambles to pull this shortish delivery but mistimes it to deep square leg
well bowled, straightening a shade right on off, pushed tightly back to the bowler
makes room outside leg now to try and go through extra cover, cannot beat the in-field
big strike from Tsotsobe, he got Guptill with a similar delivery earlier, now he has Williamson pushing at an angled length ball outside off, thick edge is snapped up low by a diving AB to his right
forced down to sweeper cover for one
pushes a tossed up ball down the track
down the track and whips a full delivery to long on
driven wide of sweeper cover for an easy couple
thick outside edge falls well short of backward point as he goes for the drive, some turn for Duminy
pushed towards cover for one
not a good line to start the over, short down the leg side, Franklin helps it fine on its way to the boundary
much better delivery, goes for the yorker at 136 kph, not as full, but he needed to be careful to squeeze it out
superb control again, hint of straightening as he sends it close to the blockhole on off again
moves across and pushes a length ball to extra cover
pushed softly down to long on for one
good length angled delivery chopped down to third man
stays beside the line and chops it to third man for one
opens the face to run this one on middle behind point
swivels for the pull, couple of bounces down to the left of deep square leg who runs across and cuts off the boundary
stays in the crease and runs it straight to point
comes down the track to have a go at this short of a length ball but is beaten by the bounce
squeezes a widish pitched up delivery to the left of squarish third man for two
Franklin falls in pursuit of runs, looks to loft this length delivery over mid off but cannot get it high and far enough to beat Amla who scrambles back to take a well-judged catch
into the pads and dribbles down towards fine leg, a fumble from Tsotsobe allows two
pitched up ball driven neatly down to the man at mid off
short ball, he quickly gets into position to crash it over midwicket
and again, another short ball, Ellis winds up, fetches it from outside off and slams it wide of mid on
worked off middle in front of square leg
tossed up outside leg stump, pushed in the air back to the bowler
leaves the crease to go over extra cover but hits it flat past that man
worked to midwicket
angled in down the pads, turned behind square leg
down the track again, but his heave goes straight to midwicket on the edge of the circle, he has a go at the non-striker's stumps but misses
swinging away from a full length, squeezed out to point
chops a length delivery from close to the body to third man
slips wide down the leg side this time
swinging away sharply outside off stump, he is beaten on the drive as he reaches out to drive
sends it down the leg side this time, not called a wide
pitched up delivery pushed down to mid on for a single
right through him at 139 kph, and the middle stump is rattled, Ellis looked to use the angle on this length ball to swing it over midwicket, missed, Steyn did not
pushed towards midwicket for one
eep, that is a wild throw from Smith, it was nowhere close to the non-striker's stumps from around short fine leg
fired into the pads, he cannot connect as he looks to work it square
fine work from AB down the leg side, Bracewell's back leg is out of his crease as he pushes well forward, and AB has the bails off quickly as the ball slips past Bracewell down leg
worked towards midwicket
worked behind square leg
pushed off the front foot to extra cover, who is on the edge of the circle
pushed to the right of extra cover for a quick single
whips from way outside off stump through midwicket
width outside off, chopped straight to point
short of a length ball, slogged over the non-striker down to long on
comes well across to work a back of a length ball behind square leg
low full toss, he reaches out but can only swing it  to extra cover
gets across and works a full delivery down to long on
has a huge slog and misses a pitched up delivery, which moves in a tad, just misses the stumps
this time he connects, swivels and sends the shortish delivery soaring over deep square leg
off stump is knocked back, Nathan looks to swing a pitched up ball on the leg side, does not connect, the ball was right on target
Southee gets four off the final delivery, makes some room and slices the full delivery high over point, a few bounces and it trickles into the boundary

inn2.comm: good length ball pushed towards extra cover
full delivery moves away sharply, driven with the movement but cover stops it well
left alone outside off
straightens just outside off stump, pushed down the track
Smith was gone by a long way had this throw from cover-point hit, Amla had driven a full one in that region and they had gone for the single
thick outside edge first ball that drops short and goes through slip, Smith pushing with an angled bat to one going across him
left alone outside off
swinging in a tad, pushed towards midwicket
closes the face and edges the back of a length ball onto thigh pad
carrying across the left-hander who has a look and lets it go
another tight single, Smith going well forward to push in front of mid on, Ellis released the ball quickly but the throw was not quick enough, missed anyway
back of a length, defended on to the pitch
drives a wide delivery, in the air, but in the gap between cover and point, and Smith gets four
moves far across and drops the shortish delivery towards point
beaten outside off this time as he pushes at a length ball leaving him
leaves alone a similar delivery
inside edge onto pad saves Smith, Mills was loud with the appeal, Smith got the bat down just in time as this one swung in full and late
towards the pads, gets across and works square on the leg side for one
pushes the pitched up away moving delivery in the gap between extra cover and mid off
beaten again, Southee angles it across and gets it to shape away a tad to beat Smith's poke
fullish on to the pads, he clips it well but square leg gets a hand to the ball
now he goes full into Amla's pads, he picks it in the air, but wide enough of square leg to run into the boundary
Southee strikes, Amla pushes, from the crease, the ball moves in from back of a length, takes the inside edge and clatters into the stumps
worked on the leg side off the pad
there is the outside edge, and Smith is gone too, Mills slides it full and wide outside off across Smith, who goes chasing after it, and the thick edge is taken at slip
left alone outside off
goes for the drive, and gets it past point
half an appeal for lbw as Mills bends it back in from a good length, going down leg though
leaves an angled ball alone outside off
gets on top of the bounce of this back of a length ball, and chops it past slips to third man
gets behind the line of a short of a length ball and defends
there was width for Duminy, but he smacked it straight to extra cover
tight line around the off stump, he runs it to point
length ball on middle played out towards mid on
pushed firmly down the ground for a couple
good length ball played out towards midwicket
Kallis whip-pulls on a leg, lifts the shortish ball and goes through with the shot, picks up four to deep midwicket
pushed towards cover
big graceful followthrough as he drives the pitched up delivery, does not find enough timing to beat mid off
punched to extra cover
not that short but he still forces the pull square on the leg side
is welcomed by a booming drive that is stopped neatly by extra cover
length ball pushed away towards cover
mistimes the cut to point, the ball wasn't wide enough for him to time the stroke well, the sun gets into Williamson's eyes as he scrambles to stop the ball
drives a full ball to mid off
stays in the crease and runs a 140 kph length ball to point
could have been close, Duminy misses as he looks to swing this shortish one square on the leg side, it pops up and falls in front of the fielder running in
drives straight, too straight as he hits the non-striker's stumps, the ricochet towards midwicket gets them one
worked in front of square leg
mistimes a forcing stroke towards short extra cover
length ball punched to short extra cover
worked off the pads straight to midwicket
punched wide of extra cover for one
straight on the pads, Kallis allows it to come on and uses the angle to whip it beautifully between mid on and midwicket, both didn't have a chance
similar delivery and similar stroke, but mistimed to mid on this time
fine stop by Bracewell, one-handed to his left, the good length ball had been pushed hard by Kallis
mindful of the short midwicket, he checks his push to the fielder
Bracewell has taken out Kallis with the short ball, Kallis looked to go behind square leg as he swivelled late for the pull, but was hurried into the shot and ended up lobbing it to square leg
worked to deep square leg for one
too much with the angle on to the pads, and de Villiers times the work through square leg so well that Bracewell has to run in a long way and put in a big slide to stop the boundary
inside edge onto pad as he looks to drive through extra cover
gets the push past cover but point gets around to take pace off the stroke
tries to angle the bat and help the length ball down to third man but it rolls to second slip
pleasing stroke, just pushes the length delivery back down the pitch with a firm straight bat, and earns three as it is hauled in with a slide
worked to midwicket
tries to run it down to third man again but gets it to second slip, who hit the stumps but de Villers' bat was in safely by then
into the pads, eased gracefully past midwicket for a couple
defended on the off side
swivels and swings down to fine leg
awkwardly helps a back of a length ball behind square leg
this time he is able to hold an angled bat and run the length ball to third man
angled length ball pushed back to the bowler
gets front foot across and works down to long on
defends down the pitch
almost got through him, Duminy looking to make room to  a quick length ball that comes in with the angle, just got the bat down in time
this time he has lots of room for the cut outside off and earns a single to sweeper cover
worked in front of square leg for one more
looks to force an angled length ball down the ground but mistimes it to mid on
eases into a push on the up to mid off
smash! almost like a vicious top-spin forehand, he fetches the rising short delivery high from outside off stump and pulls it, just past a diving midwicket
defends a full delivery
stands on his toes and punches the short of a length ball towards mid on
there have been quite a few mistimes cuts today, here is another one from AB as he goes too hard at it and chops the ball into the pitch
brings bat in front of pad to keep a bouncing length ball out off the splice
inside edge onto pad now as he looks to push this one
wants to cut the one that slides in with the angle, gets bat on it in time to hit it towards point
nudged behind square leg
whipped square on the leg side from middle
103 kph, he is bowling them quick, Duminy mistimes another stroke into the off side
driven to extra cover off the front foot
140 kph pitched up delivery angled into the stumps, defended tightly
slams the pull and it travels fast to Williamson's left at deep midwicket, he slides across to save the boundary
Duminy is dealing in inside edges at the moment, another one dribbles square on the leg side
worked through square leg for one more
superb diving stop from Williamson at cover keeps them to one, Duminy had timed this push really well
full delivery worked wide of midwicket for one
worked in front of square leg
pushed to extra cover
worked towards square leg
defended off the front foot
whipped in front of square for one
diving save at wide mid off after de Villiers leans into the drive off the full delivery
pulled in front of square leg for a single
stays back to a length ball and pushes to extra cover
similar length but on leg, and he works it behind square
length ball defended to midwicket
fuller delivery pushed to midwicket again
worked in front of square leg
full delivery just outside off, pushed back to the bowler
waits and tees off down to long on for a single
forced to wide long off for another run
length ball on middle punched back on the bounce to the bowler
excellent stop from Nathan diving to his right, saves a run for NZ
too much on the pads and tucked behind square for a single
drives a pitched up delivery straight back to Southee
turns an angled fullish delivery straight to midwicket
driven off the front foot to sweeper cover
inside edge dribbles into the off side off the pad as he looks to defend
Duminy is not timing them at all, there was width outside off stump but he ended up forcing it to cover
worked on the leg side for a single
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper cover
length ball turned away straight to midwicket
dropped softly this time wide of midwicket, Guptill is quick to release the ball, but AB is already home
another mistimed shot from Duminy goes to cover
this is the way he has been earning his runs today, inside edge past square leg
tossed up offbreak on middle, pushed to extra cover
off the inner part of the bat for Nicol to put in a dive to stop the ball
he will have to more of this, Duminy, advances down the pitch and forces it to long on
AB shows how its done, slithers out and across and turns with the spin past a diving midwicket
down the pads, worked square easily
out of nowhere, AB pulls out the big shot, he sees this one dropped a bit short and short-arm pulls it high over midwicket, there were shouts of catch, but deep midwicket had no chance
shuffles across to one that comes in to the pads and turns it square on the leg side
bowlers saves the single with a diving stop
worked behind square leg this time
full delivery pushed back to the bowler
tossed up ball driven down the pitch, Nathan is in the way again
and again, three in a row, full, tight, and he can only find Nathan with the push
takes it on the full as he comes outside his crease and works past midwicket
did that carry to Nathan at midwicket? he grimaces, Nicol has his hands on his head, looked to have dropped just short
shortish one slapped away to sweeper cover
full outside leg with the line and easily worked through midwicket
down to long on for another single, this partnership going along steadily
turned in front of square from middle and off line
does not get hold of this one as he comes down the track, but an inside edge past fine leg brings him runs
drives a full delivery past extra cover
nudged through square leg for one more
one of the few he has timed today, gets front foot out and creams it through extra cover, the man in the deep gets to it
pushed down the ground to long off
nippy length delivery from a decent run, inside edged onto the pitch
eases a widish 117 kph length ball to extra cover
worked through square leg as it comes in with the angle
some bounce from a good length, Duminy is surprised as he drops it towards point
McCullum is hit on the thumb as he fails to collect another bouncing delivery, Duminy had already missed as he looked to steer it
pushed down to long off, tidy over from Ellis
bouncing from back of a length and dropped into the off side for a quick run
helped down to third man with an angled bat
adjusts well to a slower bouncer to pull through square leg
at the last moment, he brings down an angled bat inside the line of the ball and runs it towards third man
worked behind square leg
comes down the track and flicks behind square leg for an easy two
Duminy is timing them much better now, he gets a bit of width outside off, Duminy stays in the crease and flashes the cut past backward point
pushed back to the bowler, some bounce for Ellis
another example of how better his timing has got now, not a lot of width, Duminy instantly guides it past point and beats the dive from sweeper cover
pushed towards point
brings front foot and tries to drive through extra cover, straight to the fielder
worked towards midwicket for one
turned to fine leg off the pad
adjust and whips a slow full delivery to mid on, sends Duminy back as well
fetches it from a long way outside off but finds mid on again
rides the bounce and chops it through point
AB has suddenly gone a tad jittery this over, 135 kph back of a length ball, AB tries to slog it down the ground, but it pops up and falls short of mid on
walks across this time and gets the single with a work to deep midwicket
eased down to sweeper cover for one
worked through square leg for one, NZ have given two many runs off the pads
pushed towards point
nipping in from a good length, pushed away to midwicket
pushes with a straight bat and gets it past the non-striker to long on for one
steered to third man for another single
Nicol breaks the stand, Duminy, looking to work a full delivery around leg into the on side, gets a leading edge which Nicol snaps up eagerly and throws the ball in celebration
worked behind square leg with the spin
worked wristily past square leg, 50 up for de Villiers
fullish one pushed back to the bowler
whoa, that turned in a mile from outside off, a surprised AB kept it out
could have been tight, a push towards the bowler ricocheted towards midwicket who failed to pick up the ball cleanly as they went for the run
worked square off the pads
comes well across and works through square leg for a couple
walks outside off stump, and flicks from around off and middle to fine leg, as long as it works, it's fine
defends a back of a length coming in
punched solidly down to long on
worked with the spin wide of midwicket
leading edge rolls towards extra cover
cannot work a quicker one past the bowler, he gets across on the leg side to stop it
straighter and flatter, he cuts on the bounce to backward point
worked to deep square leg
AB releases some pressure with a skip down the track, and a clean swing that takes the ball well beyond the wide long-on boundary
now Faf decides to play the big shot, advances down the pitch, and hammers the length ball over extra cover
suddenly, the shots are meatier, a shortish ball is pulled with confidence and timing to deep midwicket
allows the length ball to come on and drops it square on the leg side for a tight run

Bracewell catches Faf on the crease with one that nips back in a long way, hits him on the flap of the pad, looks high, given by the umpire, South Africa review it, replays show it would have bounced just over the stumps, can't be given, a crucial moment in the game, settled by the DRS, what if Faf had departed?
worked behind square leg
that kept low and nipped back in, and he swung awkwawrdly outside the line to get beaten
clipped through midwicket for one
swinging in full for the stumps, Faf was looking to work it on the leg side, gets an inside edge that rolls past the stumps
that is a fine stroke, walks down the track, and digs out the full delivery, it goes through Southee's hands and easily beats mid off
Southee comes back strongly and goes past the outside edge from a good length
comes out of the crease again, this time he can only push towards cover
another boundary to end the over, less than 100 needed now, low full toss flicked off the pads over midwicket
overpitched and on the pads, flicked wide of mid-on for couple by AB de Villiers
length ball on off this time, de Villiers is content to open the face and guide the ball towards point and scamper a single
slanting in towards the leg stump, worked towards backward square leg off the back foot
short of a length and just outside off, defended to the off side
short of length ball that de Villiers wanted to crash through the cover, off the bottom edge and the ball rolls in front of point
back of a length once more, angling in towards middle and off, defended from the crease towards the leg side
length ball outside off, punched towards sweeper cover
mistimes a swipe towards the bowler
back of a length and following the batsman, who was skipping outside leg stump, off the pads to the off side for one
again that favourite shot of de Villiers, hangs his bat outside off, just using the pace to guide the ball to third man
shortish ball is pulled towards wide long-on, not the most well-timed of shots, that had enough power and placement to find the rope

whoah, not something you see often, a misfield on the boundary by a New Zealander, du Plessis charges down the track and thumps the ball towards sweeper cover, Bracewell sprints to his right to try cut that off, he gets there in time but lets it through, two boundaries to end the over
pushed through point for a single
pushed down to long on
pushed to extra cover
worked off the pads behind square leg
pushed off the front foot to long off
shortish ball pulled away to deep midwicket
makes use of some width to cut hard, but hits it straight to cover
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
full delivery whipped past midwicket
AB keeps getting the boundaries now and then, uses the angle on this fullish one ending on middle to lift it over midwicket
gets it close to the blockhole, he eases it past the non-striker to long on
swung away through square leg on a knee
advances down the track and works in front of square leg
another one worked on the leg side for a single
way too short, long hop, AB winds up, opens his stance, and dispatches it into the crowd over deep midwicket
and another one, this time he sees the full delivery and skips down the pitch, and cracks it over wide long on
takes it on the full and keeps strike with a single to long on
nudged behind square leg for a single
well bowled, yorker on middle stump, he adjusts well to dig it out
clipped straight to midwicket
low full toss patted away towards mid off and they complete the single safely in the end
slams another low full toss to sweeper cover
full delivery, whipped to fine leg off the pads
South Africa in control now, another four over midwicket, they have overdone the leg stump line today, Faf puts it away with a flick in the air
pushed wide of sweeper cover for two more
crashes the pull straight to midwicket
clipped down to long on off the pads
stays in the crease and runs the length ball down to third man
works a low full toss behind square leg
cannot get hold of this very full delivery as he tries to go down the ground
outside edge dribbles down to third man as Southee follows him down leg with a full delivery
works a low full toss to deep square leg
first extras of the innings as this delivery scoots towards the keeper off the pads
in the blockhole, but AB moves on to 99 with a nudge on the leg side
he tried to follow the batsman who was making room down the leg side but ended up sending it futher wide of Faf, more extras, they have been held back long enough
Southee drops it short this time, into Faf with the angle, who finds nothing with his attempted hook
captain AB gets to a superb century under pressure when his team needed it, with a work on the leg side, acknowledges the applause with a no-fuss nod and a raise of the bat
now Faf goes to 50 in typical fashion, with a charge to the fast bowler, and clobbers the shortish ball over midwicket
he is not going to let a repeat of Dhaka happen, scurries down the pitch once again, this time he goes straight down the ground, another boundary
it's all come apart for New Zealand, Faf rubs it in with a controlled pull to a short ball, takes his third boundary in three balls, this time through midwicket
inside edge dribbles square on the leg side off a full delivery
driven stylishly straight to mid on
four more, New Zealand continue to pay for their leg-stump line, Southee goes full down the pads in search of the yorker, and a fine tickle is all that is needed
hits a pitched up delivery towards mid on for one
South Africa almost through now, AB withdraws towards the leg side, Southee drops it short, AB has a flail, and collects four with a thick edge to the fine third man boundary
smashes the drive off the full delivery to extra cover
slower bouncer gone completely wrong, down the leg side
another low full toss on the pads taken for a couple through square leg, boundary saved with a slide
he tries to finish it by making room down the leg side and eyeing extra cover, but Southee gets it around the blockhole, and he mistimes the stroke
he walks across and outside off stump looking to steer the quick and flat one but pushes it towards short third man
slants it too far across the batsman
South Africa end the chase with a stroke that has brought them so many runs today, a work square on the leg side
